casebody.data:
AMERICAN BRAKE SHOE & FOUNDRY COMPANY, Plaintiff, v. NEW YORK RAILWAYS COMPANY et al., Defendants, and City of New York, Appellant. (Circuit Court of Appeals, Second Circuit. November 1, 1926.) No. 44. Cotton & Franklin, of New York City (J. A. Fowler, Jr., of New York City, of counsel), for appellee.

Before HOUGH, MANTON, and MACK, Circuit Judges.

PER CURIAM.

This cause having been reached in its regular call on the calendar, appellant refused to proceed. We have examined the record, and have not perceived any obvious error therein.

The appeal is dismissed, with costs.
